channel.title: [Done] Help with making an ::object command [Done]
channel.description: [b]Hey guys, Can someone out there please make an [size=10pt]::object[/size] command for me, so that when you use it (::object (Object ID)) it spawns an object there and it stays there forever. Or can someone please help me (preferably through teamviewer) with moving some altars from one place to another... I know it is in globalobjects but I can't find. Thanks :D [i]PKingKingScape[/i] [/b]

item.title: [Done] Help with making an ::object command [Done]
item.dc:creator: @PKingKingScape PKingKingScape
item.description:
@PKingKingScape wrote:

LOL! Stop flaming!!!
Epic ancient: I now partially realise your sense of humour
Veikron: I am not a ‘baby’ and I do not appreciate the term ‘spoonfed’…
Both: I said I had already looked at the other topics and could not find anything! So I had every reason to post here as I could not find the ID’s of the altars to change in makeGlobalObject…

Oh and btw, please use readable grammar not some of this:

Fuck dumb shit fuck ive spoonfeed nerd java convention shit easy fucking dumb dont spoon

It is alot easier to read that without the flame/crap.

Thanks again everybody.

(Stop posting/flaming, topic closed.)

Read full topic

[quote=“PKingKingScape, post:5, topic:300543”]Thanks for help guys. And I KNOW that you are not a spoonfeeding community, if you look round I doubt you will find anything on making an ::object command, that stays down, like i asked for.
Anyway, although I already said I had looked at makeglobalobject in client.java… I looked again and found it, so thanks for your help.
BTW. Epic Ancient, if you are as harsh to NEW and DUMB members as you are to me, we won’t be getting many new members, they will walk right away again. You have to be nice, everyone has to start somewhere…

Thanks again for help… :)[/quote]

My sense of humor is not always recognized.

item.title: [Done] Help with making an ::object command [Done]
item.dc:creator: @PKingKingScape PKingKingScape
item.description:
@PKingKingScape wrote:

Thanks for help guys. And I KNOW that you are not a spoonfeeding community, if you look round I doubt you will find anything on making an ::object command, that stays down, like i asked for.
Anyway, although I already said I had looked at makeglobalobject in client.java… I looked again and found it, so thanks for your help.
BTW. Epic Ancient, if you are as harsh to NEW and DUMB members as you are to me, we won’t be getting many new members, they will walk right away again. You have to be nice, everyone has to start somewhere…

Thanks again for help…

item.title: [Done] Help with making an ::object command [Done]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

0 = south
-1 = East
-2 = North
-3 = West

Try not to be wrong. :x

Read full topic

item.title: [Done] Help with making an ::object command [Done]
item.dc:creator: @patsquare patsquare
item.description:
@patsquare wrote:

you can always go to client.java search for makeglobalobject
something like this should come up [code] public void NewObjects() {

    makeGlobalObject(2510, 3863, 2783, -3, 10);// Anvil
    makeGlobalObject(2843, 2964, 61, -3, 10); // Ancient Alter
    makeGlobalObject(3042, 4843, 2781, 0, 10);// Furnace 
    makeGlobalObject(2378, 3438, 2287, -1, 10);// Obstacle Pipe
    makeGlobalObject(2380, 3440, 2193, 0, 10);// Chest
    makeGlobalObject(2383, 3427, 3816, 1, 10);// Kitchen Drawers
    makeGlobalObject(2572, 3853, 9398, -2, 10); // shopportal
    makeGlobalObject(3350, 3347, 7324, 0, 10); // blue portal
    makeGlobalObject(2381, 3438, 4172, -1, 10); // Range

[/code]
the first 2 numbers are the co-ordinates were the object is
the third number is the object id
the forth nubber is were you want the object to face theer are 0=west -1 =north -2=east -3=south
the fifth number im not sure

Read full topic

Can someone out there please make an [size=10pt]::object[/size] command for me, so that when you use it (::object (Object ID)) it spawns an object there and it stays there forever.
Or can someone please help me (preferably through teamviewer) with moving some altars from one place to another… I know it is in globalobjects but I can’t find.
Thanks
PKingKingScape
[/quote]

::object command never places them down for good.
We’re not a spoonfeeding community, try and make it yourself. Don’t say you did because I know you haven’t.
Try searching. This has been covered.
